intro: Hysterionica chamomilloides, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The flowers are used in herbal teas and traditional medicine for their calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
